segments.content: The Poet and s-poet method is based on a clustering approach. The method is able to successfully estimate structures with very small clusters.
The latent factor model is used to model asset correlations. It allows the idiosyncratic components of asset returns to be associated with one of a total of m clusters.

All of the model parameters -the factor loadings and idiosyncratic covariance -need to be estimated from the data sample y. The estimators generally follow a two-step procedure:1. estimate the common componenti, using the first k principal components.2. different estimates ψ are obtained from s by applying some sparsityinducing procedures.

We consider a collection of daily us stock returns from january 1995 to january 2017. We select the top p stocks by market capitalization at the time defined by current date. We use several, most common classification performance measures to evaluate the ability of the proposed estimators to identify the true sparsity patterns.

Csh is more flexible and able to deal with both simulation cases very well, while the csk struggles in the partial block-diagonal case. The clustering based estimators benefit widely from increased dimensionality in both simulation scenarios.

The paper proposes a unified approach to estimating the block-diagonal idiosyncratic covariance of high-dimensional financial return time series. Both clustering approaches benefit from increased dimensionality and demonstrate stable results for different numbers of simulated series.
